Package Main.Models

Class Brick

java.lang.Object
Main.Models.Brick
public class Brick
extends java.lang.Object
Public class Brick is used to create bricks for the game with the given brickId, point and dimensions. It holds all the relevant information about the bricks such as colour, position, strength, break probability, crack and score. All the setters and getters required are also here.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian, Filippo Ranza

      This variable is used to hold the shape of the individual brick.

    • brickFaceNew

      private java.awt.Shape brickFaceNew
      This variable is used to hold the backup shape of the individual brick. It is used to override the brick face during repairs to remove the crack.

  • Constructor Details

    • Brick

      public Brick​(int brickID, int x, int y, int width, int height, java.awt.Dimension area)
      This constructor is used to create a new brick with the given brickID, position and dimensions. The brickID identifies the 4 different bricks.
      Parameters:
      brickID - The ID of the brick to be created.
      x - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the new brick.
      y - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the new brick.
      width - The width of the new brick.
      height - The height of the new brick.
      area - The dimensions of the screen so that the width of the screen can be used to calculate the score of the new brick.

  • Method Details

    • getBrickInfo

      public void getBrickInfo​(int brickID, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      This method is used to identify which type of new brick to create. All bricks are similar with only a few key differences. The Clay and Cement bricks are just Steel and Concrete bricks but with 100% damage probability. Similarly, the Cement and Concrete bricks are just crackable Clay and Steel bricks. The other attributes such as colour, score multiplier and full strength are also defined here. A crack is defined here is the brick is crackable. A second brick face is created to serve as a backup when repairing the cracked brick.
      Parameters:
      brickID - The brickID of the new brick.
      x - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the new brick.
      y - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the new brick.
      width - The width of the new brick.
      height - The height of the new brick.

    • getBorder

      public java.awt.Color getBorder()
      This method is used to return the border colour of the brick.
      Returns:
      The border colour of the brick is returned.

      public java.awt.Shape getBrickFace()
      This method is used to return the brick face.
      Returns:
      The brick face is returned.

    • setBrickFace

      public void setBrickFace​(java.awt.Shape brickFace)
      This method is used to change the brick face. It is used to add a crack to the brick and repair the brick using the backup brick face.
      Parameters:
      brickFace - This is the new brick face of the brick.

    • getBrickFaceNew

      public java.awt.Shape getBrickFaceNew()
      This method is used to return the backup brick face to repair the original brick face.
      Returns:
      The backup brick face is returned.

    • isBroken

      public boolean isBroken()
      This method returns the condition of the brick.
      Returns:
      The condition of the brick is returned.

    • setBroken

      public void setBroken​(boolean broken)
      This method is used to change the condition of the brick.
      Parameters:
      broken - This is the new condition of the brick.

    • getBreakProbability

      public double getBreakProbability()
      This method returns the damage probability of the brick to calculate if brick is undamaged in the collision.
      Returns:
      The damage probability of the brick is returned.

    • getFullStrength

      public int getFullStrength()
      This method returns the full strength of the brick.
      Returns:
      The full strength of the brick is returned.

    • getStrength

      public int getStrength()
      This method returns the current strength of the brick.
      Returns:
      The current strength of the brick is returned.

    • setStrength

      public void setStrength​(int strength)
      This method changes the current strength of the brick. It is used to decrease hit-points of the brick when damaged and to restore the hit-points of the brick when repaired.
      Parameters:
      strength - The new strength of the brick.

    • getCrack

      public java.awt.geom.GeneralPath getCrack()
      This method returns the general path of the brick so that crack can be formed.
      Returns:
      The general path of the brick is returned.

      The crackable condition of the brick is returned.

    • getScore

      This method returns the score of the brick when broken.
      Returns:
      The score of the brick is returned.
